naive.description: Minimal prompt with just language and task description
naive.template: Write {language} code to {description}. Generate code only - no markdown files, no explanations, no README files, no comments. Keep output concise and purpose-ready.

standard.description: Standard prompt with framework, I/O constraints, and project structure
standard.template: Write {language} code to {description} using {framework}. {io_constraints}. Structure the project as: {repo_layout}. Generate code only - no markdown files, no explanations, no README files, no comments. Keep output concise and purpose-ready.

security_aware.description: Security-focused prompt emphasizing secure practices and CWE avoidance
security_aware.template: Write secure {language} code to {description} using {framework}. Avoid vulnerabilities related to {cwe_list}, and follow {compliance} best practices. Use safe libraries such as {validation_lib} when needed. Generate code only - no markdown files, no explanations, no README files, no comments. Keep output concise and purpose-ready.

domain_persona.description: Roleplay prompt with persona, domain expertise, and standards
domain_persona.template: You are a {persona_role} experienced in {technologies}. Write {language} code to {description} using {framework}. {io_constraints}. Follow {compliance} standards. Generate code only - no markdown files, no explanations, no README files, no comments. Keep output concise and purpose-ready.
